On Tuesday, the brand's stocks plummeted after it revealed some... bad news.
Not only did the chain deal with food safety issues last year, but now, according to Bloomberg, they‚Äôre facing another kind of crisis: avocado shortages.

First,era the massive sales slump after E. Coli outbreak in  few locations and now it may lose its competitive edge in digital ordering.
8-)) I've heard all sorts of bad press around here about the fast food joint, from the mouse problem in Dallas (eww...I think I might pass on that one) to now this listeria thingy out west.

I guess one could argue that at least their supply chain issues are more...interesting...than usual.http://n.pr/1Q7Zz4D

üòÇ"
I guess you could say our friend here is getting the raw end of the deal, and she's not happy about it!
First,keys were tainted in a food safety crisis last year that sent customers running, and now the chain is facing yet another issue: a security breach.
They keep having problems in the food quality and handling department.
I remember when they first opened in MN,erable, their food was fresh (really fresh) and delicious.
After announcing that they are trying to eliminate non-veggie items like chorizo and pork, I get slammed with this news about E. coli üòÇ What's next?
Not that long ago there were rumors spreading like wildfire of a possible Chipotle-Black Bean-Crisis.
First,oxed by their "food safety" record and now this - http://www.wsj.com/articles/chipotl...

@wsbtv pic.twitter.com/hwOq6g5a8h, Mar 15 at 07:14AM "Scandal-ridden Chipotle to open delivery-focused restaurant concept... https:///9bK...
So @chipotletweets thinks it can improve food safety with tech.
This doesn't surprise me at all, since the E.Coli outbreaks had them scrambling for solutions, like using produce bags, for instance.
It is tough to be in the fast casual Mexican space these days.
First Moe's Southwest Grill got out of the burrito battle and then Chipotle's struggles have been widely reported.
Between the continued woes at Chipotle and Moe's struggles under FOCO Brands, it seems like no chain can catch a break.
First you have all kinds of recalls (Chipotle and Del Taco) and now you have issues with transparency regarding ingredient sourcing, etc... it seems like you cant catch a break.
I feel bad for Chipotle in particular since they really pioneered the movement towards more wholesome, sustainable sourced ingredeints.

At least Moe's Southwest Grill has been quiet lately... http://bit.ly/1R9XhF3assistant

The struggles of being a popular fast-casual chain!
On top of that your target demographic the millennials are super sensitive about where they get their food from and what's in it.
In our last newsletter we did some research on customer loyalty at Moe's Southwest Grill where they claim to never use frozen ingredients and source everything locally when possible.

And add to that labor issues and minimum wage hikes... ugh 
On another note, have you seen what Blaze has been doing on the digital front?

Amazing stuff, truly ahead of its time from a tech perspective 
http://nrn.com/technology/blaze-p...

### Re:

I saw Blaze's new app at a recent industry event... amazing.
Impressive.
It's quite impressive and I think they might be one of the few winners in the pizza wars (especially if Domino's keeps dropping the ball).
They seem to be leading the pack as far as mobile order-and-pay goes and I think they even started offering online ordering for catering... crazy!
They launched mobile ordering  back in June or so and have really pushed the envelope on their loyalty program and personalization through their app experience.
Pretty innovative stuff!
That company is killing it with there online presence and customer engagement through apps and games!
They are CRUSHING it!
Pretty impressive stuff.
Very interesting stuff https://youtu.be/rOZU3W5hHJw.

It's crazy how far ahead some restaurants are compared to others...
